head.og_title: WebP to ICO Converter - Free & Online

h1.title: Convert WebP to ICO Online
h1.description: Free and fast WebP to ICO converter for favicons and desktop icons. Works instantly on any device — no signup required.

description:
Transform your WebP to ICO in seconds. ICO is the native icon format for Windows and the de-facto standard for web favicons. We preserve transparency (alpha) and generate multiple sizes so your icon stays sharp on tabs, shortcuts, and high-DPI screens.

Note: Animated WebP files are converted as a static icon using the first frame.

converter.title: WebP to ICO Converter
converter.description: Convert WebP images to multi-size ICO icons with transparency preserved.

h2.title: Why Convert WebP to ICO?
h2.description:
ICO is purpose-built for icons and favicons:

  • Multi-size in one file: Bundle 16–256 px variants for crisp rendering everywhere.
  • Favicon standard: Recognized by all major browsers.
  • Windows native: Ideal for desktop/app/shortcut icons.
  • Transparency: Full alpha support for smooth edges.

h2.title: How to Convert WebP to ICO Online
h2.description:
1. Click Upload WebP and select your image.
  2. Wait for processing and optimization.
  3. Click Download ICO to save your icon.

We auto-generate common sizes for sharp results.

h2.title: ICO vs WebP Comparison
h2.description:
• Use case: ICO for icons/favicons; WebP for general web images.
  • Transparency: Both support alpha; ICO keeps edges clean at small sizes.
  • Animation: ICO is static; animated WebP becomes a static icon (first frame).

h2.title: Supported Limits & Formats
h2.description:
• Accepted input: WebP (image/webp)
  • Maximum file size: 16 MB per file
  • Output: ICO (.ico, image/x-icon)

h2.title: Best Practices for Sharp Icons
h2.description:
• Start with a square source and add padding to avoid clipping.
  • Use bold shapes and high contrast for 16–32 px sizes.
  • If your WebP has a busy background, simplify it for better small-size clarity.

h2.title: Troubleshooting
h2.description:
• Favicon not updating: Clear cache and link /favicon.ico via <link rel="icon" href="/favicon.ico">.
  • Looks jagged at 16 px: Upload a larger, clean source; downscaling improves sharpness.
  • Upload fails: Ensure image/webp and ≤ 16 MB.

faq.question: Is this WebP to ICO converter free?
faq.answer: Yes, it’s completely free with no watermarks or hidden charges.

faq.question: What sizes are supported for ICO files?
Does it keep transparency?
faq.answer: Yes. If your WebP includes an alpha channel, the ICO preserves it (32-bit RGBA entries).

faq.question: Do you support animated WebP?
faq.answer: Animated WebP is converted as a static icon using the first frame.

faq.question: Can I convert multiple WebPs at once?
faq.answer: This page converts one file at a time. Repeat the process for multiple files.

faq.question: What file sizes are supported?
faq.answer: You can upload images up to 16 MB per file.

note: ICO files are optimized for small display sizes. For best results, use a square, high-contrast source and include some padding.
